comments.text:
yeah okay, no one said REM isn't a stage of sleep... EVERYONE knows that, 
but when you're trying to act like you're sleeping, with eyes shut, 
assuming he knows what's going on, what are the chances of seeing REM 
movement RIGHT as when someone touches his face? REM happens regardless. We 
would've seen REM BEFORE his face was touched. Why at the EXACT moment his 
face was touched? REM has NOTHING to do with touch, it's just a consistent 
movement. So we would've seen his eyes moving before that, not ONLY RIGHT 
when his face was touched. I'm not convinced anymore of these pranks, it's 
obvious they'd like to maximize their profits from youtube just for the 
insane amount of views. STILL HOWEVER, I WILL BE A VIEWER, because their 
videos are cool anyways

captions.text: Hi, I'm Erik Meldik and this is revenge

to Cenek for what he
did to me in the airplane.
These are the dudes, hey dudes!

I'm going to Cenek's place to edit
and I'm going to get my revenge!
I'm going to get the dudes.

- He's completely out.
- How much did you give him?
I'll take this and let's to it!

- Take the hat.
- Right, the hat. Here.
Get out and take the wheel.
I'll stay with him, close the door.
Hurry up, we gotta catch the Orloj.

Here's a lot of people
waiting for the sleeping Cenek.

It's nice to see, that people
have a good taste in entertainment.

- Where should I put him?
- Under the Orloj.

Is this it?
Girls, film it, please.

- I have to wake him up.
- Come on, record it!

Put him to sleep and where does
he appear? I'll wake him up.

I gave him two pills, dude,
this won't wake him.

- Hi Cenek!
- What are you doing, you d*ckhead?
I don't think this is normal, man.

What are you doing?
It's a joke.
Where am I supposed to go now?
We'll take you in the car, it's okay.
